message.content:
{"id": "2345", "title": "Bug 2345 [Editor Mgmt] Open with a different type of editor has no effect if file already open (1GEWMSQ)", "description": "Bug 2345 [Editor Mgmt] Open with a different type of editor has no effect if file already open (1GEWMSQ)", "OB": "Open a new basic project and create a new file named test.xml. The default editor for XML files is the scripted resource editor example. Select test.xml in the Navigator and choose 'Open With... / Default Text Editor'. Note that nothing happens and the scripted resource editor example is reactivated.", "EB": "When selecting 'Open With... / Default Text Editor' for a file that is already open in a different editor type, a new editor should be opened on the file instead of reactivating the existing editor.", "SR": "1. Open a new basic project.
2. Create a new file named 'test.xml'.
3. Select 'test.xml' in the Navigator.
4. Choose 'Open With... / Default Text Editor'.
5. Verify that a new editor is opened on the file, considering the different editor type.

NOTES: The current behavior is incorrect as it reactivates the existing editor instead of opening a new one based on the editor type."}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '2345', 'title': 'Bug 2345[Editor Mgmt] Open with a different type of editor has no effect if file already open (1GEWMSQ)', 'description': 'Bug 2345[Editor Mgmt] Open with a different type of editor has no effect if file already open (1GEWMSQ) ', 'OB': '', 'EB': "Reproduce the steps in: 1GEWMOZ: ITPUI:WIN2000Scripted resource editor example opens on XML files by default new basic project new file test.xml the editor used is the scripted resource editor example, which totally ignores the XML file content select test.xml in Navigator choose Open With... / Default Text Editor nothing happens; it's reactivating the scripted resource editor exampleSearching for an existing open file should also consider editor types.It should open a new editor on the file, because the editor type is different.NOTES: ", 'SR': "Reproduce the steps in: 1GEWMOZ: ITPUI:WIN2000Scripted resource editor example opens on XML files by default new basic project new file test.xml the editor used is the scripted resource editor example, which totally ignores the XML file content select test.xml in Navigator choose Open With... / Default Text Editor nothing happens; it's reactivating the scripted resource editor exampleSearching for an existing open file should also consider editor types.It should open a new editor on the file, because the editor type is different.NOTES: "}
